Hydration Habit Tracker

- Single-file Python 3 script using only standard library (json, datetime, os, pathlib, shutil).
- Console-based TUI with numbered menu: 1) Log water intake (cups, 8oz each), 2) View daily/weekly summary, 3) Set daily goal (cups), 4) Export JSON, 5) Import JSON, 6) Print-friendly report, 7) Quit.
- Auto-detect dark/light terminal theme using os.environ['TERM'] and adjust color output (use ANSI escapes: \033[90m dim gray for dark, \033[37m white for light).
- Data persistence: Store entries in 'hydration.json' as list of dicts: {'date': 'YYYY-MM-DD', 'cups': int, 'time': 'HH:MM'}. Load on start, auto-save after each log.

  - Log entry: Prompt cups (1-20), auto-add timestamp, validate input.

  - Export: Write full data to 'hydration_export.json'.

  - Print-report: Generate text table of last 30 days, progress trends, motivational tips (e.g., "Stay hydrated!"), use print() for console-friendly fixed-width columns.
- Keyboard support: Accept 'q' to quit any prompt, arrow keys via getch() polyfill using sys.stdin.read(1).
- Error handling: Graceful file errors, input validation (ints only), backup JSON on corruption.
- Testable: Run script, log 3 entries, check summary matches, export/import, verify print output copies cleanly.
